alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 22 at 3:27PM AKDT until March 23 at 11:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. Visibilities possibly reduced to one quarter mile or less at times. * WHERE...Kuskokwim Delta. * WHEN...From Thursday morning for Nunivak Island and coastal locations through Thursday evening for inland locations. * IMPACTS...Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A quick moving compact low pressure system will impact the area beginning Thursday morning. As the front moves inland by the afternoon hours, visibility from Nunivak Island and coastal areas will improve quickly while inland areas will experience visibility reductions later into the afternoon and evening hours.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Watch for blizzard conditions means there is a potential for falling and/or blowing snow with strong winds and extremely poor visibilities. This can lead to whiteout conditions and make travel very hazardous.
